casebody.data:
Harold A. DUREL, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. The SOUTHERN PACIFIC RAILROAD, Defendant-Appellee, Aetna Casualty & Surety Company, Intervenor-Appellee. No. 31028

Summary Calendar.*

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. June 25, 1971. Gibson Tucker, Jr., New Orleans, La., Howard B. DeJean, Jr., Opelousas, La., Tucker & Schonekas, New Orleans, La., for plaintiff-appellant. Richard C. Meaux, Davidson, Meaux, Onebane & Donohoe, Lafayette, La., for Southern Pacific. Patrick A. Juneau, Jr., Lafayette, La., for Aetna.

Before THORNBERRY, MORGAN and CLARK, Circuit Judges.

Rule 18, 5th Cir.; see Isbell Enterprises v. Citizens Casualty Co. of N.Y., 431 F.2d 409, Part I (5th Cir. 1970).

 PER CURIAM:

Affirmed. See Local Rule 21.1

. See NLRB v. Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, 430 F.2d 966 (5th Cir. 1970).
